Megatron X had long since departed the battle at the Black Fortress.=A0 As =
flashy an entrance he made an exit.=A0 The mission had failed due to circum=
stances beyond his control, but it did nothing to console his mind.=A0 He w=
as flying low to the sea's surface when his sensors picked up something cur=
ious.
=A0
A spark signature.=A0 
=A0
Intensifying his scans of the area, he=
 found it was only a spark.=A0 transforming and landing, Megatron knelt dow=
n over what appeared to be the wreck of a transformer.=A0 Possibly female b=
y how some of the remaining parts were set and shaped.=A0 There was no tell=
ing how long it had been here, or what the spark was of.=A0 Could be a true=
 raving lunatic.=A0 No real way of knowing.=A0 And if he gave it a body, it=
 may turn out to have lost its identity or become comatose.
=A0
But he had =
nothing better to do.=A0 Megatron carefully removed the spark chamber from =
it's lifeless husk and stored it in a sompartment, connecting an energy lin=
e to it to maybe stabilize and strengthen it for the rigors of travel.

---=
 On Mon, 9/8/08, Lady Barbossa <MaximaSR74@...> wrote:

From: Lady Barb=
ossa <MaximaSR74@...>

Date: Monday, September 8, 2008, 1:56 AM






Several stellar cycles pa=
ssed since the Decepticon femme fatale went 
missing. 
Had anyone wondered =
where she'd gotten to? What became of her? 

No, these were not thoughts ru=
nning through her processor. For that had 
decayed. That part of her that w=
as organic was now gone, decayed having 
rotted away. But those parts of he=
r that were metallic and machine... 
was barely there. Rusted and decaying =
as well. 
All that lay in the darken remains was a small indestructable hul=
l, a 
chamber that held her very weak spark. 

Unknown location, far from w=
here she once called her home base with the 
Predacons, far from the reache=
s of their scanners. 

There in the rubble of ashe and stone, within the ca=
verns of a 
mountainous region near the sea... near the lava that was touch=
ing the 
salty waters causing the heat of the cavern to be overly steamy...=
 here 
was where this lone spark was isolated. 
That spark in that chamber =
barely surrounded by the remains of a beast 
machine.

Content-Type: text/html; charset=us-ascii

<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" ><tr><td valign="top" style="font: inherit;"><DIV>Megatron X had long since departed the battle at the Black Fortress.  As flashy an entrance he made an exit.  The mission had failed due to circumstances beyond his control, but it did nothing to console his mind.  He was flying low to the sea's surface when his sensors picked up something curious.</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>A spark signature.  </DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>Intensifying his scans of the area, he found it was only a spark.  transforming and landing, Megatron knelt down over what appeared to be the wreck of a transformer.  Possibly female by how some of the remaining parts were set and shaped.  There was no telling how long it had been here, or what the spark was of.  Could be a true raving lunatic.  No real way of knowing.  And if he gave it a body, it may turn out to have lost its identity or become comatose.</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>But he had nothing better to do.  Megatron carefully removed the spark chamber from it's lifeless husk and stored it in a sompartment, connecting an energy line to it to maybe stabilize and strengthen it for the rigors of travel.<BR><BR>--- On <B>Mon, 9/8/08, Lady Barbossa <I><MaximaSR74@...></I></B> wrote:<BR></DIV>
<BLOCKQUOTE style="PADDING-LEFT: 5px; MARGIN-LEFT: 5px; BORDER-LEFT: rgb(16,16,255) 2px solid">From: Lady Barbossa <MaximaSR74@...><BR>Subject: A Spark of Hope<BR>To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com<BR>Date: Monday, September 8, 2008, 1:56 AM<BR><BR>
<DIV id=yiv1689457725>
<DIV id=ygrp-text>
<DIV>Several stellar cycles passed since the Decepticon femme fatale went <BR>missing. <BR>Had anyone wondered where she'd gotten to? What became of her? <BR><BR>No, these were not thoughts running through her processor. For that had <BR>decayed. That part of her that was organic was now gone, decayed having <BR>rotted away. But those parts of her that were metallic and machine... <BR>was barely there. Rusted and decaying as well. <BR>All that lay in the darken remains was a small indestructable hull, a <BR>chamber that held her very weak spark. <BR><BR>Unknown location, far from where she once called her home base with the <BR>Predacons, far from the reaches of their scanners. <BR><BR>There in the rubble of ashe and stone, within the caverns of a <BR>mountainous region near the sea... near the lava that was touching the <BR>salty waters causing the heat of the cavern to be overly steamy... here <BR>was where this lone spark was isolated. <BR>That spark
 in that chamber barely surrounded by the remains of a beast <BR>machine. <BR><BR></DIV></DIV></DIV></BLOCKQUOTE></td></tr></table><br>
